result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle Dawn Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice. 
2) The court assessed only the DNA surcharge and waived all other court costs in this matter. 
3) The defendant shall pay at a minimum rate of $50 per month to probation.
4) If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
The defendant must complete an AODA and comply with any treatment that may be recommended.
The defendant shall maintain gainful employment or pursue higher education.

No use or possession of any alcohol, illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. 

Burnett County case 22CM159 was DRI.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
10:50 AM Cases 22CF158 and 22CM159 called together.  Defendant Danielle Dawn Rodriguez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Danielle Dawn Rodriguez.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Erdman: def pleading to misdemeanor amphetamine (amended Count 1 of 22CF158), DRI remainder, joint rec for 1 yr probation.  Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  State moves to amend Count 1 of 22CF158 to misdemeanor possession of amphetamine; Court grants.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea.  Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of amended Count 1 of 22CF158, misdemeanor possession of amphetamine and orders a JOC; Count 2 and 22CM159 are DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def does not make a statement to the Court.  
Court orders:
1 year probation; 7 months jail imposed/stayed consecutive to any other sentence if revoked
Conditions of probation:
No use or possession of any alcohol, illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. The defendant must complete an AODA and comply with any treatment that may be recommended. Gainful employment or continued education.  $200 DNA only, $50 per month to probation.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  104 days jail credit, attorneys to confirm and update Court to get JOC amended if that figure is inaccurate.
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.

3:05 PM 22CF158 and 22CM159 called together.  Defendant Danielle Dawn Rodriguez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Danielle Dawn Rodriguez.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Def appears by video from Bayfield County Jail.  Case 22CF158 on for Status Conference; 22CM159 is set for initial appearance.  Court notes the ADA has a conflict, would need to stand mute.  Atty Erdman not appointed in the 22CM159.  Case 22CM159 proceeds to Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def enters NG plea.  Atty Erdman updates Court: believes resolution has been reached, def in jail until 10/10/22; agreement contemplates probation.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 7, 2022 at 10:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Danielle Dawn Rodriguez
Current: 7173 Loon Creek Circle, P.O. Box #233, Danbury, WI 54830 United States  (Effective: 07-06-2022)
Prior: 7173 Loon Creek Circle, Danbury, WI 54830 United States

Bond to cover Burnett County cases 22GF257 and 22CF158.  The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.

11:38 AM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Danielle Dawn Rodriguez in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Danielle Dawn Rodriguez. Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on October 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:22 PM Called 22CF158 for PH.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Danielle Dawn Rodriguez in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Danielle Dawn Rodriguez.  Attny Erdman moving forward with PH.  Case is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Officer Katelyn Barker, who is sworn in and testifies. Attny Erdman steps out with def at 2:24pm.  Resume at 2:25pm with same appearances as previously noted. Officer Barker continues testifying.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made. The State would rest.  Attny Erdman cross examines. No further questions.  State has no redirect, would ask for bind over.  Attny Erdman has no witnesses today.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State files information.  Arraignment scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 11:30 am.
